intro: Peucedanum carvifolium var. aestivale, commonly known as summer cowparsley, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small yellow flowers that bloom in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. It is native to Europe and has been introduced to other regions, including parts of North America. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in herbal medicine, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
